advancementOptions.name: Total Control
advancementOptions.description: You take the hacked synthetic's action. You may use its spells and abilities.

advancementOptions.name: Power Down
advancementOptions.description: When you have a creature hacked, you may use your action to attempt to shut it down. To do so, make an Intelligence check contested by the hacked creature's Intelligence check. If you win the contest, the creature becomes incapacitated for 1 hour and the spell ends.

advancementOptions.name: Disorient
advancementOptions.description: Creatures that fail the saving throw become disoriented. Until the end of your next turn, attacks made against the creature has advantage and the creature can't take reactions.

advancementOptions.name: Debilitate
advancementOptions.description: Creatures that fail the saving throw can barely move. Until the end of your next turn, the creature's speed becomes 0 and it automatically fails Dexterity saving throws.

advancementOptions.name: Disorient
advancementOptions.description: Creatures that fail the Constitution saving throw have disadvantage on their next attack roll.

advancementOptions.name: Phasic
advancementOptions.description: Annihilation Field's damage bypasses shields.

name: Backlash
castingTime: Reaction, which you take when you are hit by an attack

advancementOptions.name: Durable
advancementOptions.description: Increase the aegis's hit points to 30.

advancementOptions.name: Counterstrike
advancementOptions.description: If you cast Backlash as a reaction against a melee attack, gain an attack of opportunity against the attacking creature.

advancementOptions.name: Bleeding Blades
advancementOptions.description: On a hit, the target takes an additional 3d12 damage at the start of its turn due to blood loss. This damage bypasses shields.

advancementOptions.name: Exploding blades
advancementOptions.description: On a hit, the target takes an additional 1d12 thunder damage and must pass a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus) or becomes stunned until the end of your next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Shaped Lift
advancementOptions.description: You may choose the shape of the detonation into a cone, cube, or cylinder. You may also shape it into a line, if you do, the line is twice as long as the sphere's radius and 2m wide.

advancementOptions.name: Heavy Lift
advancementOptions.description: Large creatures are affected. If you spend at least 4 barrier ticks, Huge creatures must make the saving throw.

advancementOptions.name: Reactive
advancementOptions.description: When you are hit by a ranged attack while the this spell is active, you may use your reaction to deal the cold damage to a creature within 2 meters of you.

advancementOptions.name: Cold Aura
advancementOptions.description: While the BEC field is active, you are immune to the Frozen condition. Creatures that take damage from this spell are primed (cold).

advancementOptions.name: Anti-Flesh
advancementOptions.description: Deals twice as much damage to organic creatures with no shield points.

advancementOptions.name: Remote Deploy
advancementOptions.description: As an action, you can set up your Beehive in a separate location. Once it is deployed you can use an Attack action to fire it. You can also fire it as a reaction whenever a creature enters its 6m cone.

name: Biotic Jump
castingTime: Reaction, which you take when you jump as part of your movement

advancementOptions.name: Hover
advancementOptions.description: At any point during your jump, you can end your movement and hover in place. At the start of your next turn, you float to the ground, taking half your movement for that turn.

advancementOptions.name: Safe Landing
advancementOptions.description: When landing in Difficult Terrain, you automatically succeed on your Dexterity (Acrobatics) check to remain standing. Additionally, if you would land within an area that causes a Dexterity saving throw, you have advantage on the save.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Orbs
advancementOptions.description: You may expend 2 orbs to cast a spell using your highest available spell slot.

advancementOptions.name: Retribution
advancementOptions.description: As a reaction to taking damage, you may expend all of your remaining biotic orbs. For each expended orb, make a ranged spell attack on a target you can see within range. You can direct all attacks to hit one creature or several.

advancementOptions.name: Efficient Punch
advancementOptions.description: On a hit, gain 3 barrier ticks.

advancementOptions.name: Siphoning Strike
advancementOptions.description: On a hit, instead of gaining barrier ticks, gain 10 shield points.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Damage
advancementOptions.description: Increase the damage die to 2d12

advancementOptions.name: Destined Hit
advancementOptions.description: Gain a +5 bonus to your next melee weapon attack roll

advancementOptions.name: Infuse Ammo
advancementOptions.description: Friendly creatures inside the sphere add 1d6 force damage to all ranged weapon attacks against creatures outside of the sphere. This damage can detonate primed targets.

advancementOptions.name: Armored
advancementOptions.description: The sphere has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, and thunder damage, but only has 75 hit points.

advancementOptions.name: Lifting Wall
advancementOptions.description: If a creature comes within 2m of the wall, you can use your reaction to make a pocket of negatively charged space near the creature's location. It must pass a Strength saving throw or become lifted until the end of your next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Shifting Wall
advancementOptions.description: As a bonus action, you can either move the wall up to 6m in any direction, rotate the wall up to 180 degrees, or reshape the wall within the parameters listed above.

name: Blade Armor
castingTime: Bonus Action or Reaction, which you take when you are dealt damage

advancementOptions.name: Poisoned Armor
advancementOptions.description: Creatures hit by your blade armor must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour.

advancementOptions.name: Retribution
advancementOptions.description: When a creature within 2m of you hits you with a melee attack while blade armor is active, you may use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack with blade armor against the creature.

advancementOptions.name: Salvo
advancementOptions.description: When you cast Salvo, you may target a number of objects equal to or less than your spellcasting ability modifier. The combined weight of the objects cannot exceed the maximum weight limit of the spell (10 kilos at 1st level, 12 kilos at 2nd level, etc).

advancementOptions.name: Counterstrike
advancementOptions.description: As a reaction, which you take when a creature within 30m you casts a spell or makes an attack. Fling the object toward the creature which fails its Dexterity saving throw. If the creature was casting a spell, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or he spell fails (DC 10 or half the Catapult damage, whichever is higher). If the creature was attacking, it has disadvantage on the attack roll.

advancementOptions.name: Barrier Regen
advancementOptions.description: After you cast Charge, if you have an active barrier, regain 2 barrier ticks and reset the duration of your barrier to 1 minute.

advancementOptions.name: Area Charge
advancementOptions.description: Each creature within 4m of the target must make the Dexterity saving throw.

advancementOptions.name: Stunning Shot
advancementOptions.description: A creature hit by concussive shot must make a Constitution saving throw instead of a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the end of its next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Improved shot
advancementOptions.description: Increase the bonus damage of concussive shot to d12.

advancementOptions.name: Brittle Freeze
advancementOptions.description: Shields no longer provide advantage on the saving throw. On a successful save, a creature is primed cold until the end of your next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Frozen Ground
advancementOptions.description: Cryo beam leaves a patch of ice on the ground that lasts for 1 min. The ground is considered difficult terrain.

advancementOptions.name: Ice Lance
advancementOptions.description: Transform the blast into a deadly lance. Make a ranged spell attack dealing 1d8 cold and 2d4 piercing damage. It deals an additional 1d8 and 2d4 for each slot level above the 1st.

advancementOptions.name: Frigid Air
advancementOptions.description: The blast creates a pocket of frigid air that lasts until the end of your next turn. Each creature that enters the frozen space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there becomes primed cold until the end of its next turn and takes 2d6 cold damage.

advancementOptions.name: Cooldown
advancementOptions.description: If creature that fails its saving throw casts a tech or biotic spell, it cannot cast another tech or biotic spell until the end of its next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Power Damping
advancementOptions.description: Creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw against this spell.

advancementOptions.name: Cripple
advancementOptions.description: If the affected creature would make a saving throw or attack roll, as a reaction you may increase the severity of Dark Channel. The affected creature must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Damage
advancementOptions.description: Increase the damage die type to d10

advancementOptions.name: Control
advancementOptions.description: Before the sphere moves, you may change its direction and speed. Its speed becomes 4m, 6m, or 8m.

advancementOptions.name: Amplify
advancementOptions.description: Add 1d8 to the detonation damage for each 4m the sphere travels.

advancementOptions.name: Explosive
advancementOptions.description: As an action, you can detonate your Decoy. Each creature within 4m of the decoy must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d6 thunder damage or half as much on a successful one.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Decoy
advancementOptions.description: Your decoy becomes so life-like that creatures have disadvantage on the Wisdom (Perception) check.

advancementOptions.name: Shield
advancementOptions.description: Deploy the matrix as a stationary shield. Up to 2 creatures of medium size can stand behind the shield, gaining half-cover. It lasts 1 minute and no longer requires concentration.

advancementOptions.name: Custom Current
advancementOptions.description: When you cast defense matrix, choose one damage type. You have resistance to that type while defense matrix is active.

name: Disrupt Biotics
castingTime: Reaction, which you take when you see a creature casting a biotic spell

advancementOptions.name: Lockdown
advancementOptions.description: If you successfully disrupt the spell, you overload the target's biotic implant and it cannot cast biotic spells until the end of your next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Psychic Strain
advancementOptions.description: If successfully disrupt the spell, the target takes Xd10 psychic damage, where X is the level of the spell. Targets take 1d6 psychic damage for disrupted cantrips.

advancementOptions.name: Total Control
advancementOptions.description: You take the dominated creature's action. You may use its spells and abilities.

advancementOptions.name: Damage
advancementOptions.description: While the creature is dominated, it takes 4d6 psychic damage at the end of its turn. This damage bypasses shields and does not proc an opportunity to end Dominate.

advancementOptions.name: Shield Restore
advancementOptions.description: If you are wearing armor, gain shield points equal to half of your damage roll.

advancementOptions.name: Paralyze
advancementOptions.description: Creatures that fail the saving throw are paralyzed until the end of their next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Linked Current
advancementOptions.description: On a successful hit, you can designate yourself or an ally within range of the ability to direct a positive current. Instead of gaining shield points, this current doubles a creature's waking speed for 1d4 rounds. Using this advanced tech skill more than once does not stack the speed boost.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Regen
advancementOptions.description: On a successful hit, you regain shield points equal to the amount of lightning damage dealt.

advancementOptions.name: Adaptive
advancementOptions.description: The healed creature gains resistance to the last damage type it suffered. This effect lasts for 1 minute.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Healing
advancementOptions.description: Increase the healing die type to d12

advancementOptions.name: Shredder
advancementOptions.description: If a creature with 0 shield points takes damage from Flak Cannon, it becomes wounded. A wounded creature takes 1d4 damage from blood loss at the start of each of its turns. A wounded creature can make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success. Alternatively, any creature (including the wounded creature), can make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check or use a charge of Medi-gel, ending the effect on a success.

advancementOptions.name: Stunner
advancementOptions.description: When you attack with Flak Cannon, you can choose to fire concussive blasts dealing no damage. Creatures within the sphere must instead make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes stunned until the start of your next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Concentrated Burn
advancementOptions.description: Increase the damage to d12 and the distance to 12m, but the area-of-effect is now a line instead of a cone.

advancementOptions.name: Exhaust
advancementOptions.description: The flames create a thick smoke in an 8m cube that must encompass the cone. The area is considered heavily obscured until the end of your next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Blind
advancementOptions.description: Each creature is blinded no matter the result of its saving throw.

advancementOptions.name: Heat seeking flare
advancementOptions.description: Instead of choosing 4 targets, you may instead choose 1. If you do so, the target has disadvantage on the saving throw. Increase the damage by 4d12.

advancementOptions.name: Speed
advancementOptions.description: You may cast Fly as a bonus action. Increase the fly speed to 30m

advancementOptions.name: Extended Cast
advancementOptions.description: The duration of fly becomes 30 minutes.

name: Fortification
castingTime: Reaction, which you take when you are targeted by an attack you can see

advancementOptions.name: Lasting Fortification
advancementOptions.description: Fortification lasts an additional turn.

advancementOptions.name: Venting Fortification
advancementOptions.description: When fortification ends, the currents are sent to your gauntlets. Your next melee weapon attack is made at advantage and deals an additional 2d10 bludgeoning damage.

advancementOptions.name: Pulsing Field
advancementOptions.description: As a bonus action, for the duration of the spell, you can force a number of creatures equal to twice the spell level that are within the gravity field to make a Strength saving throw or be restrained until the spell ends.

advancementOptions.name: Warping Field
advancementOptions.description: A creature takes 1d6 necrotic damage per spell level when it enters the gravity field for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

advancementOptions.name: Multi-Tap
advancementOptions.description: Guidance can be active on up to 3 different targets.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Tap
advancementOptions.description: Increase the die type to d10

advancementOptions.name: Improved Distance
advancementOptions.description: You can jump up to 12m.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Radius
advancementOptions.description: Increase the radius of the impact to 4m

advancementOptions.name: Anti-Shield
advancementOptions.description: The missile detonates a small EMP, transforming the damage to lightning.

advancementOptions.name: Three-headed beast
advancementOptions.description: Your missile splits into three separate missiles, each dealing 1d6 damage (2d6 at 5th level, 3d6 at 11th level and 4d6 at 17th level). You can direct the missiles at the same target or at different ones.

advancementOptions.name: Stutter Step
advancementOptions.description: This spell's range is decreased to 12m, but you may cast this spell twice as part of the same action, choosing a different target for each cast. Each cast consumes spell slots as normal.

advancementOptions.name: Heavy Step
advancementOptions.description: You can transport Large or smaller creatures and objects as long as the total weight does not exceed four times your carrying capacity.

advancementOptions.name: Hearty Shield
advancementOptions.description: Increase the shield's hit points to 100.

advancementOptions.name: Large Shield
advancementOptions.description: The Shield covers a 4m wide area.

advancementOptions.name: Frozen Combo
advancementOptions.description: When you hit a creature or object with incinerate, if the target is primed cold, you deal a critical hit.

advancementOptions.name: Radial Blast
advancementOptions.description: On a miss, the target makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes half damage.

advancementOptions.name: Exploding Swarm
advancementOptions.description: As a bonus action, you can target a creature affected by one of your swarms and detonate it. The target takes 3d8 thunder damage.

advancementOptions.name: Plague
advancementOptions.description: Three swarms spread from the initial target to as many as three other targets. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of swarms increases by 1 for each spell slot above the 1st.

advancementOptions.name: Anti-shield
advancementOptions.description: Lance deals an additional 2d4 lightning damage. This damage increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above the first.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Damage
advancementOptions.description: Increase the damage die type to d12.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Grapple
advancementOptions.description: The grappled creature has disadvantage when trying to escape.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Damage
advancementOptions.description: Increase the damage die type to d12.

advancementOptions.name: Magician
advancementOptions.description: You can exert fine motor control over the object, such as manipulating a simple tool or removing an object from a container.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Lift
advancementOptions.description: You can manipulate an object that weighs up to 25 kgs (~55 pounds).

name: Nanite Cloud
castingTime: Reaction, which you take when you would take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage.

advancementOptions.name: Nanite Grenade
advancementOptions.description: While active, use a bonus action to compress the nanites into a grenade. The grenade remains stable for 1 hour before becoming inert. The grenade has a 10m range, 4m blast radius, DC 14 Dexterity saving throw and deals 4d6 damage of the triggering damage type. The grenade deals and additional 2d6 damage for each spell level beyond 1st.

advancementOptions.name: Aegis
advancementOptions.description: You may cast this spell as a reaction when a creature within 2m of you takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. Choose up to 3 creatures including yourself within 2m of you to gain resistance to the chosen damage type until the start of your next turn, including against the triggering attack.

advancementOptions.name: Damage
advancementOptions.description: The target takes 2d6 psychic damage when hit by the ion laser. This damage increases by 2d6 for each slot level above the 1st.

advancementOptions.name: Paralyze
advancementOptions.description: If a creature fails the saving throw, it is paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Paralyze
advancementOptions.description: A creature that fails the Constitution saving throw becomes paralyzed until the end of your next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Powerful Poison
advancementOptions.description: The creature has disadvantage on its Constitution saving throw.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Damage
advancementOptions.description: Increase the damage die to d12.

advancementOptions.name: Half blast
advancementOptions.description: When you cast nova, it consumes half of your remaining barrier ticks (rounded up) but deals damage as if you had used all of your remaining barrier ticks.

advancementOptions.name: Extended Leap
advancementOptions.description: Overload can leap to as many as five other targets within 10m.

advancementOptions.name: Heavy Overload
advancementOptions.description: Increase the damage die type to d8.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Damage
advancementOptions.description: Increase the damage die type to d6.

advancementOptions.name: Cripple
advancementOptions.description: A creature hit by Phase Disruptor has disadvantage on its next attack roll.

advancementOptions.name: Loyalty
advancementOptions.description: If you successfully use this ability on a creature for 30 days in a row, the creature develops a fierce, chemically-induced sense of loyalty to you and remains charmed by you indefinitely.

advancementOptions.name: Aggression
advancementOptions.description: You are able to modify the pheromone cocktail to send creatures into a frenzy. When you use this ability, you may choose to frenzy creatures instead of charming them. A creature that becomes frenzied must use its movement to move towards the nearest creature and attack them if able. A frenzied creature may repeat its save at the end of each of its turns.

advancementOptions.name: Pepper spray
advancementOptions.description: Creatures that fail the Constitution saving throw are also blinded for 1 minute.

advancementOptions.name: Poison Cloud
advancementOptions.description: Create a 2m-radius cloud of poison that persists for 1 minute. Each creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there must make the Constitution saving throw.

advancementOptions.name: Heavy Pull
advancementOptions.description: You may target a Large or smaller creature or object.

advancementOptions.name: Grip
advancementOptions.description: While maintaining this spell, you may use your bonus action to increase pressure around the target, dealing 2d6 bludgeoning damage.

advancementOptions.name: Area Reave
advancementOptions.description: The orb becomes unstable and explodes when it reaches the target. Hit or miss, the target and each creature within 2m of it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 2d6 necrotic damage. This damage increases by 2d6 for each spell slot level above the first.

advancementOptions.name: Immediate Detonation
advancementOptions.description: When you hit a target with reave, it detonates the primed condition at the end of your turn.

advancementOptions.name: Primed
advancementOptions.description: After the weapon fires, it vents its heat and the attacking creature becomes primed (fire) until the start of its next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Backfire
advancementOptions.description: After the weapon fires, it deals 2d6 thunder damage to the attacking creature.

advancementOptions.name: Exploding Salvo
advancementOptions.description: Each dart deals an additional 1d4 thunder damage.

advancementOptions.name: Blinding Salvo
advancementOptions.description: When you cast salvo, you may create phosphorous darts instead. The darts no longer deal damage and cannot detonate primed targets. Instead, each dart explodes in a bright flash of light. Each creature hit by a dart must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or becomes blinded until the end of your next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Cryo Turret
advancementOptions.description: The turret's mass accelerator machinegun deals 7 (2d6) piercing and 7 (2d6) cold damage. Instead of flamethrower, the turret can innately cast cryo beam 5 times per day.

advancementOptions.name: Shields
advancementOptions.description: The turret has 30 shield points (regen 0).

advancementOptions.name: Restoring Shock
advancementOptions.description: Gain shield points equal to half the damage dealt. This cannot increase your shield points beyond their maximum capacity.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Shock
advancementOptions.description: Increase the range to 4m and damage to d8.

advancementOptions.name: Controlled Shockwave
advancementOptions.description: The shockwave travels 16m. You may change the direction of the line every 4m.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Damage
advancementOptions.description: Increase damage die type to d10

advancementOptions.name: Improved Pulse
advancementOptions.description: Add your Constitution modifier to the DC of the saving throw as you increase the frequency of the pulse to a level you can barely withstand.

advancementOptions.name: Lingering Pulse
advancementOptions.description: Each creature that takes psychic damage from siege pulse has disadvantage on its melee or ranged attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Heavy Singularity
advancementOptions.description: Creatures have disadvantage when making the Strength saving throw or Strength (Athletics) check.

advancementOptions.name: Damage
advancementOptions.description: Any creature within singularity's radius is primed (necrotic) and takes 1d8 necrotic damage at the end of each of your turns.

advancementOptions.name: Stun
advancementOptions.description: If the target is a creature, it must pass a Constitution saving throw or becomes stunned until the end of your next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Reaction
advancementOptions.description: When a creature or object you can see becomes lifted, you may cast Slam on it as a reaction.

name: Slow Fall
castingTime: Reaction, which you take when you or a creature within 10m of you falls

advancementOptions.name: Improved Duration
advancementOptions.description: Increase the duration to 5 minutes

advancementOptions.name: Navigate
advancementOptions.description: As you fall, you can direct your fall by 2m in any direction except up. You may do this once per round.

advancementOptions.name: Solid Freeze
advancementOptions.description: The ice solid like a rock. Creatures have disadvantage on their Strength checks to break it.

advancementOptions.name: Brittle Freeze
advancementOptions.description: A critical success on the Strength check completely shatters the affected creature's appendage. If legs, it falls prone and loses half its remaining hit points. If head, it immediately dies.

advancementOptions.name: Shatter
advancementOptions.description: When stasis ends via a successful saving throw or detonating attack, the target takes 2d8 force damage for each round of combat it was in stasis.

advancementOptions.name: Deep Stasis
advancementOptions.description: The creature has disadvantage on its saving throws to escape Stasis.

advancementOptions.name: Friendly
advancementOptions.description: You can inject a willing creature within melee range with the stimulant pack.

advancementOptions.name: High Tolerance
advancementOptions.description: You can use stimulant pack twice long rest.

advancementOptions.name: Necrotic Bolts
advancementOptions.description: Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to cause a bolt of necrotic energy to leap from the center of the sphere toward one creature you choose within 20m of the center. Make a ranged spell attack. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is in the sphere. On a hit, the target takes 4d10 necrotic damage. Necrotic bolts can detonate primed targets.

advancementOptions.name: Growing Storm
advancementOptions.description: While the spell is maintained, the storm's radius grows by 2m at the start of your turn.

advancementOptions.name: Electrified Net
advancementOptions.description: If you have a submission net deployed, you can use your bonus action to send electric currents through it. Each creature within the net takes 2d6 lightning damage.

advancementOptions.name: Anti-Tech
advancementOptions.description: If a creature you can see begins to cast a tech spell, you can use your reaction to cast submission net.

advancementOptions.name: Area Scan
advancementOptions.description: Scan a 6m cube. Each creature within the cube must make the Charisma (Deception) check against your Wisdom (Insight). This feature only affects a single target, but you can choose one creature from the ones that failed the contested check.

advancementOptions.name: Telegraphed Attacks
advancementOptions.description: Your HUD alerts you when the creature is about to attack. It has disadvantage on ranged and melee attacks against you and you have advantage on any saving throws caused by spells and abilities of the creature.

advancementOptions.name: Heavy Weapon Sync
advancementOptions.description: Information about the painted targets sync with heavy weapon systems. Any creature that would make a saving throw to avoid heavy weapon damage has disadvantage on the saving throw.

advancementOptions.name: Lasting Scan
advancementOptions.description: Becomes a concentration spell with a duration of 1 minute.

advancementOptions.name: Anti-Biotics
advancementOptions.description: A creature with an active barrier that is hit by this spell must expend all remaining barrier ticks to reduce the damage. The total damage reduction from the remaining barrier ticks is reduced by half.

advancementOptions.name: Anti-Synthetic
advancementOptions.description: Non-organic creatures or objects take an extra 40 force damage. This spell disintegrates up to a 6m cube of synthetic materials.

advancementOptions.name: Radial Blast
advancementOptions.description: On a hit, the damage is dealt to each creature within a 2m radius of the target.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Damage
advancementOptions.description: Increase the damage die type to d12

name: Trophy System
castingTime: Reaction, which you take when an explosive projectile is within 6m of you.

advancementOptions.name: Advanced Notice
advancementOptions.description: The triggering range is increased to 12 meters, and you may detonate the explosive at any point along its trajectory.

advancementOptions.name: Dual Trophy
advancementOptions.description: You may use your trophy system twice between long rests.

advancementOptions.name: Improved Damage
advancementOptions.description: +2 damage with the turbocharged weapon

advancementOptions.name: Improved Accuracy
advancementOptions.description: The DC of the Dexterity saving throw is increased to 18

advancementOptions.name: Unrestricted (engineer only)
advancementOptions.description: Engineers can spend any amount of tech points to cast this spell. They are not limited by their Tech Point Limit column.

advancementOptions.name: Shield restore
advancementOptions.description: When you cast this at 1st level, creatures also gain 1d4 shield points. This increases by 1d4 for each spell slot above the 2nd.

advancementOptions.name: Radial
advancementOptions.description: You may cast the vortex in a 6m radius sphere centered on you instead.

advancementOptions.name: Damage
advancementOptions.description: Increase the damage to d12

advancementOptions.name: Internal Bleeding
advancementOptions.description: The shifting causes internal bleeding. At the start of each of your turns, the target suffers 1d6 damage from blood loss, bypassing its shields. This effect ends if the creature uses medi-gel or if it or another creature passes a DC 10 Wisdom (Medicine) check to stabilize the bleeding.

advancementOptions.name: Disorient
advancementOptions.description: A target hit by warp must pass a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the force of warp is so intense the target is stunned until the end of its next turn.

advancementOptions.name: Burst
advancementOptions.description: As a bonus action, you can end this spell and force each creature within 2 meters of the cloud to make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 4d4 force damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. This damage increases by 4d4 force damage per spell level.

advancementOptions.name: Shift
advancementOptions.description: As a bonus action, you can move this cube of warp energy up to 4 meters in any direction you choose. It can pass through solid objects, but you can only control it's movement while you have line of sight.
